Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Writing large file to storage device causes very large garbage collector delays to other threads" (#1473) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. The attached project is just a new opengl project with very small modifications to show this bug. A new thread is created to just continuously try and write to the sd card, the function is called DoThread(). The other modification is just to allocate some memory then set the variable to null each time OnRenderFrame is called, the allocation is large to give the GC something to dispose of. I also call  GC.Collect(); just to make sure it is called each frame, the same effect happens if you dont force the GC however it can take a little longer to happen. 
2. Run the attached project (preferably on mid or low range devices) and notice that the time between renders of frames which is output to the android log can be very delayed, on a samsung galaxy note 2 it can take up to 7 seconds between frames.

[TestMemoryAlloc.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1844821/TestMemoryAlloc.zip)

### Expected Behavior
The render thread should continue rendering with only 30ms of delay from the garbage collector like normally happens.

### Actual Behavior
The render thread can be delayed up to 7 seconds when the writing a file on another thread. I tested on an android 4.4, android 5.0 and android 7.0, the 7.0 had a much faster storage device so the effect was less but still up to 400ms. I also had similar results with File.Copy(string source, string destination) I also had similar results creating a native C++ dll to do the file write. I first noticed this issue when doing a File.Copy and it was a large file which resulted in 3 seconds of freeze on all the threads.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "await within method with returntype Task<T> makes app crash" (#1472) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open attached project
2. Run attached project
3. Debug through the `App.Foo` method. `Task.Delay` will make the app crashing without any error. In fact any await will make the app crash.
4. Just noticed: The error seems only to occur when debugging through the program (when just running the app, it shows the MainView).
5. Notice if you change the signature of method Foo to `Task<bool> Foo<TResponse>()` the app works correctly. 

[BugApp1.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1844786/BugApp1.zip)



### Expected Behavior
Delay the thread by 500 ms.
### Actual Behavior
Crashes without any Exception. Log shows the following error message (hopefully I've picked the right one - check it yourself):
`03-24 21:44:15.602 F/        ( 4720): /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-android-d15-6/xamarin-android/external/mono/mono/mini/debugger-agent.c:4846: (null) assembly:mscorlib.dll type:BadImageFormatException member:<none>`

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[api-compatibility] Only check stable API levels" (#1458) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
[xamarin-android build #915][0] reports various api-compatibility failures, such as: [0]: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/915/consoleText

### API BREAK BETWEEN v8.1 and v8.1.99

Namespace Android.Telephony

Type Changed: Android.Telephony.CellIdentityCdma

Modified base type: Java.Lang.Object Android.Telephony.CellIdentity We want to ignore these for now, as these changes are against an *unstable* API level, and we don't want to have to ensure intra-API-stability for unstable API levels. (In part becuase we haven't enumified unstable API levels, because they're in flux.) Update `$(STABLE_API_LEVELS)` so that it includes API-27 -- which should have been done in f41afb61 -- and update `make run-api-compatibility-tests` so that it only checks `$(STABLE_FRAMEWORKS)`, not *all* frameworks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] fix failing NetStandardReferenceTest on Windows" (#1470) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/index?buildId=1515010&tab=ms.vss-test-web.test-result-details

Since f7c942d, the NUnit tests have been failing on Windows. The
`NetStandardReferenceTest` is looking for `System.IO.Compression.dll`
inside the APK, but it is not there.

Looking into it, I don't see anything that explicitly needs
`System.IO.Compression.dll`, so perhaps we really don't need to assert
that this file exists.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unable to call Xamarin.Forms.Init from Android.App.Application" (#1467) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
According to Xamarin docs, Xamarin.Forms.Init is supposed to be called from an activity because it needs context, I was calling this in my main activity. However, we recently onboarded with Intune and our app now starts with a MAMApplication where this initialization needs to happen instead of main activity. The reason for that is that the intune sdk needs to refresh tokens periodically, for which it wakes our app in the background to refresh a token. When this happens, main activity is not triggered and according to their docs, Xamarin.Forms.Init should be instantiated in Application.onMAMCreate(). However, in order to do that initialization in Application class, I need context, for which I was calling global::Android.App.Application.Context, but this is null when apps are woken in the background. Please guide us on how to proceed when we need initialization to happen in the background. We cannot initialize Xamarin.Forms in an activity due to this error:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Run android unit tests for result." (#1466) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello Team, I had a question regarding the [Test APK](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/3f587f51b4bd36eab229069d7dce293659d8da62/Documentation/building/unix-instructions.md#running-individual-apk-projects) topic.

Is there a way to use the [`tests/RunApkTests.targets`](../../tests/RunApkTests.targets) and
[`build-tools/scripts/TestApks.targets`](../../build-tools/scripts/TestApks.targets)
files. so I can reuse the targets to run my own android unit tests and get results as part as our continuous integration?

I tried using the [NUnit Tutorial](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/android/troubleshooting/questions/automate-android-nunit-test) with no success. I also created an issue [here](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/xamarin-docs/issues/65) but I keep researching and found the targets there. 

I'd rather use these targets through a nuget package as opposed to manually downloading the target files and their associated files.

Any suggestions?
Thank you for your time!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ItemSelected is not called in grouped listview if an item view has TapGestureRecognizer (3.0.0.296286-pre2)" (#2180) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
ItemSelected is not called on a grouped listview, which has label with TapGestureRecognizer:

`<ListView.ItemTemplate>`
`    <DataTemplate>`
`          <ViewCell>`
`             ......`
`             <Label1>`
`             <Label2>`
`             ......`
`             <LabelX>`
`<LabelX.GestureRecognizers>`
`    <TapGestureRecognizer Tapped="OnCommentIconClick" CommandParameter="{Binding .}"/>`
`</LabelX.GestureRecognizers>`

Tapped event is called on the LabelX, but the ItemSelected  event is not triggered if you click on other controls (e.g.: Label1, Label2)

This used to work in Xamarin.Forms.2.5.0.122203, but after upgrading to Xamarin.Forms.3.0.0.296286-pre2, ItemSelected  is not called.

Might be related to this fix: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1331
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create ListView in XAML, with IsGroupingEnabled = true
2. Create GroupHeaderTemplate and ItemTemplate
3. Make sure ItemTemplate ViewCell has several views, and at least a Label, which has TapGestureRecognizer 
4. In C# / ContentPage constructor add event handler to ListView.ItemSelected : `_listView.ItemSelected += async (sender, e) => { ........}`

### Expected Behavior
If you click on a list item (not header):
-click on the label with TapGestureRecognizer: Tapped function is called **[this works]**
-click on any other view in the list: ItemSelected event triggered **[this does NOT work]**

### Actual Behavior
If you click on a list item (not header):
-click on the label with TapGestureRecognizer: Tapped function is called
-click on any other view in the list: ItemSelected event is **NOT** triggered

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms.3.0.0.296286-pre2
- Last known good version:  Xamarin.Forms.2.5.0.122203
- IDE: VS2017 15.6.4
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  11.1 [NOT TESTED]
  - Android: 8.1
- Android Support Library Version: 
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I don't remember version where all worked good but I remember date. It was at November of last year.
I've noticed this for Android and have not checked this for iOS

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create button
2. Create some event and handler to it
3. In this handler write this code

```
_butAdd.FadeTo(0, 300);
Task.Delay(300).Wait();
_butAdd.IsVisible = false;
```
or
```
 _butAdd.FadeTo(1, 300);
 _butAdd.IsVisible = true;
 Task.Delay(300).Wait();
```
### Expected Behavior
Button must achieve or bunk slowly
### Actual Behavior
But it achieves or bunk instantly
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  not checked
  - Android: some
  - UWP:  not checked

- Nuget Packages: Last stable
- Affected Devices: Visual Studio emulator and real Huawei Honor 8 Lite

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Navigating back from page with HasNavigationBar=false resizes page incorrectly" (#2178) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
We have a problem where the content of a page(1) WITH NavigationBar is cut off at the bottom when navigating BACK from a page(2) WITHOUT NavigationBar. Seems like the page is incorrectly updating its size on reappearing based on the old value of NavigationBar.HasNavigationBar.
I am setting the property in the constructor like this:
```
		public Page2()
		{
			InitializeComponent();
			NavigationPage.SetHasNavigationBar(this, false);
		}
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. You have Page1 with a NavigationBar. 
Page1 has two Labels. LabelA FillAndExpands and LabelB is 70 pts in height.
2. Push Page2 with no NavigationBar, HasNavigationBar=false
3. Now pop Page2 and witness that LabelB is cut off

### Expected Behavior
Page1 shows the whole content on reappearring
### Actual Behavior
PageA's content is cut off by the same amount of height as the iOS NavigationBar.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: -
- IDE: 
Visual Studio For Mac 7.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
 iOS: 11.2
- Nuget Packages: 
Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0.280555
- Affected Devices:
iPhones
iPads
iOS Simulators


### Screenshots
![hasnavigationbarerrordemo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6933856/37865233-d8c4c730-2f79-11e8-89d4-53aa76d5e034.gif)


### Reproduction Link

[NavigationBarErrorSample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1844478/NavigationBarErrorSample.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can not set attached property with same name as event name in XAML." (#2130) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Can not set attached property with same name as event name in XAML.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. For example, create a "PageBehavior" class
2. Create an attached property named "Appearing" in the "PageBehavior" class
3. Define "Appearing" attached property in MainPage.xaml

```xaml
<ContentPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
             xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
             xmlns:local="clr-namespace:XFormsApp"
             x:Class="XFormsApp.MainPage"
             local:PageBehavior.Appearing="{Binding InitializeCommand}">
```

### Expected Behavior

There is no error.

### Actual Behavior

The following message appears in the error list

> Can not cast object of type 'Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.ElementNode' to type 'Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.ValueNode'.

This message translated Japanese, so it is not accurate.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:2.5.0.280555 and other
- Last known good version:Unknown
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 Version 15.6.2
- Platform Target Frameworks: All
- Nuget Packages:
Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0.280555

### Screenshots

![ss03-0033](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16175660/37594210-e3845f66-2bb7-11e8-8ebc-719761d29acf.png)

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/nuitsjp/XamarinErrorReports

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Previewer cannot find CSS or XAML after adding it" (#2069) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: ### Description After adding a XAML file for a ResourceDictionary or a CSS file for StyleSheet, the Previewer throws an error indicating it cannot be found, even though the file is present. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Add a CSS file 2. Add the CSS file to the current XAML document 3. Observe the error. ### Expected Behavior IF the Previewer requires a recompile, I would expect to see that message with a quick option to perform the action. ### Actual Behavior We see an error that is inaccurate. We also see the same error on a different, subsequently selected page. ### Basic Information - Version with issue: Nightly - IDE: [VS Mac 7.4](https://gist.github.com/davidortinau/de3a9e14d083102d7163a1caa5047726) (1026) ### Screenshots ### Reproduction Link https://davidortinau.visualstudio.com/Flexibility > VS bug #580672

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Span Binding not updating even after OnPropertyChanged" (#2177) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Span Binding not updating even after OnPropertyChanged
### Steps to Reproduce

1. ViewModel with INotifyPropertyChanged
2. Bind Span inside formated text inside lable to a property
3. change the value of the property and call OnPropertyChanged

### Expected Behavior
the value updates
### Actual Behavior
the value stays the same
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.1.0.309646
- Last known good version:
- IDE: visual studio


@adamped Please check this one out since you did the #1850 PR for this

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Removing docs" (#2174) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Removes local docs folders. Updates the readme to remove the docs step. Removes docs update batch script.

This change also creates placeholder files for 
`Xamarin.Forms.Core.xml`
`Xamarin.Forms.Maps.xml`
`Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.xml`
so that local nuget builds continue to work.

Launch failed. The app '[AppName].iOS' could not be launched on 'iPhone'. Error: error MT0000: Unexpected error - Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com. Please check the logs for more details.

Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and execute  monotouch-test on device with Release, linkall  and no llvm enabled


### Expected Behavior
Tests should execute successfully on device
### Actual Behavior
Protocol test in binding project is failing
[FAIL] ProtocolTest.OnlyProtocol :   [Protocol] IP1
[FAIL] ProtocolTest.ProtocolWithBaseType :   [Protocol] IP2

This issue didn't occur in d15-6, seems to be a regression with d15-7.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[XI] App failed to launch on device with Dyld Message: Library not loaded: @rpath/libmonosgen-2.0.dylib" (#3811) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run monotouch-test on device with Debug and fast dev disabled. App runs successfully on device.
2. Build and run monotouch-test device with Debug and fastdev enabled.


### Expected Behavior
App should launch successfully
### Actual Behavior
App got installed but failed to launch. Device Log showed: 
Dyld Error Message:
Dyld Message: Library not loaded: @rpath/libmonosgen-2.0.dylib

Cleaning the solution fixed the launching issue.
